intro: Marsdenia paraguaiensis, commonly known as the Paraguay moonseed, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange to red berries. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and traditional uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
